issues.title: Alert Deduplication Missing
issues.description:
The check_alerts() function creates new alert records on every check interval (30 seconds) without checking for existing unresolved alerts with the same condition. This causes duplicate alerts to accumulate in the database, making alert management impossible.

Impact: Alert table grows unbounded, alert fatigue, impossible to track actual issues.

Location: Lines 303-361 in launch_agent_dashboard.py

Remediation: Add deduplication check before INSERT:
```python
cursor.execute('''
    SELECT id FROM alerts 
    WHERE agent_name = ? AND alert_type = ? AND message = ? AND resolved = 0
    ORDER BY timestamp DESC LIMIT 1
''', (agent_name, alert_type, message))
existing = cursor.fetchone()
if existing:
    continue  # Skip duplicate
```

issues.title: Notion Registry Sync Not Implemented
issues.description:
Dashboard is not registered in the Notion Scripts/Services registry. A TODO comment exists on line 154, but no implementation. The Discovery Engine can index the dashboard file, but it won't appear in the centralized service registry, breaking control-plane visibility.

Impact: Service not discoverable via Notion registry, missing from service inventory, no centralized service management.

Location: Line 154 in launch_agent_dashboard.py

Remediation: Implement registry sync using notion_audit_storage.py or create dedicated sync function that creates/updates a page in the Scripts/Services database with dashboard metadata.

issues.title: Graceful Shutdown Handler Missing
issues.description:
No signal handlers for SIGTERM/SIGINT. When Flask app receives shutdown signal, monitor threads may not clean up properly, leading to resource leaks and orphaned database connections.

Impact: Resource leaks, orphaned threads, database connections not closed, potential data corruption.

Location: Lines 560-576 in launch_agent_dashboard.py

Remediation: Add signal handlers:
```python
import signal
def shutdown_handler(sig, frame):
    logger.info("Shutting down dashboard...")
    if monitor:
        monitor.stop()
    time.sleep(2)  # Give threads time to finish
    sys.exit(0)
signal.signal(signal.SIGTERM, shutdown_handler)
signal.signal(signal.SIGINT, shutdown_handler)
```

issues.title: History API Lacks Pagination
issues.description:
The /api/history/<agent_name> endpoint accepts hours parameter but has no limit on result size. Large time ranges (e.g., 168 hours = 1 week) with 30-second intervals could return thousands of records, causing memory spikes and slow API responses.

Impact: Memory usage spikes, slow API responses, potential timeouts, poor user experience.

Location: Lines 444-500 in launch_agent_dashboard.py

Remediation: Add limit parameter with default (e.g., 1000 records) and enforce maximum (e.g., 5000 records). Implement cursor-based pagination if needed.

issues.title: Notion Health Status Sync Stub
issues.description:
The update_notion_health_status() function is a stub with only a pass statement. Health status is not synced to Notion, breaking control-plane visibility requirements.

Impact: Health status not visible in Notion control plane, missing observability integration.

Location: Lines 429-442 in centralized_health_monitor.py

Remediation: Implement Notion page creation/update logic using notion_client. Define database schema for health status (agent_name, status, timestamp, metrics). Create or update pages on each health check interval.

issues.title: Circuit Breaker Missing for Failed Agents
issues.description:
No circuit breaker for agents with repeated health check failures. If an agent consistently fails (e.g., process not found, service unreachable), the monitor loop continues attempting checks every 10 seconds indefinitely.

Impact: Wasted CPU cycles, log spam, potential resource exhaustion, reduced monitoring efficiency.

Location: Lines 444-520 in centralized_health_monitor.py

Remediation: Implement failure count tracking and backoff. Skip checks for agents with >5 consecutive failures for 5 minutes. Reset failure count on successful check.

issues.title: Capability Validation Missing
issues.description:
Capabilities are defined in capabilities_dashboard.json but not loaded or validated at runtime. No mechanism ensures the dashboard actually implements the claimed capabilities.

Impact: Capability registry is documentation-only, not enforced. Risk of capability drift (code changes without registry updates).

Location: capabilities_dashboard.json (entire file)

Remediation: Add capability validation in dashboard startup or create capability compliance checker that verifies implementation against registry.

issues.title: Local LLM Integration Hooks Missing
issues.description:
No hooks for local LLM integration. Cannot leverage local models for alert summarization, issue classification, health summary generation, or log triage.

Impact: Missing cost-effective AI assistance, manual alert management required, no automated issue classification.

Location: Entire dashboard system

Remediation: Create llm/local_llm_client.py module with HTTP/command interface. Add hooks in check_alerts() for alert summarization, in monitor_worker() for health summaries, and new classify_alert() function. Add configuration keys to unified config.

issues.title: Issue Tracking Automation Missing
issues.description:
No automated issue tracking pipeline. Discovered issues cannot be automatically synced to Linear or GitHub Issues. Manual issue creation required.

Impact: Issues not tracked in centralized system, manual overhead, risk of issues being forgotten.

Location: Missing tools/issue_catalog_loader.py, tools/linear_sync.py, tools/github_issue_sync.py

Remediation: Create issue catalog loader that reads JSON issue files. Implement Linear API integration for issue creation. Implement GitHub Issues API integration. Add CLI tool for syncing. Add GitHub Actions workflow for automated syncing.

issues.title: Execution-Logs Integration Missing
issues.description:
Dashboard operations are not logged to Execution-Logs database. No correlation with Notion task execution logs or agent handoff workflows.

Impact: Missing audit trail, no correlation with task execution, reduced observability.

Location: Entire dashboard system

Remediation: Integrate with Execution-Logs database. Log dashboard startup, health check cycles, alert generation, and significant operations. Use unified logging patterns for consistency.
